attributes.action: Impeach the Speaker for willful misconduct in a public office.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In order to rescue and restore parliamentary democracy for ourselves and future generations, despite the members and leaders of the present Parliament being unable or unwilling to understand public anger, not only regarding the venality of expenses abuses and other corruption, but also and increasingly, public anger at the Speaker's continuing heedless response to this, it is necessary that:

He be impeached by Parliament for trial there on a charge of willful misconduct in public office, for intimidating rather than supporting the Fees Office official, Andrew Walker, who sought the Speaker's authority to end the expenses scandal in 2005, before it so damaged Parliament's standing. 

The Institution of Parliamentary Democracy is not the property of any one parliament to squander.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
